result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony James Trepania

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony James Trepania in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CM 31.  8:18 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites plea agreement plead to count 1 in 14 CM 306 count 2 and 15 CM 31 would be dismissed read-in- 30 days jail credit 15 days and costs.  Atty Yohnk agrees as does the defendant.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of no contest.  Court finds defendant guilty and dismissed and read-in count 2 and 15 CM 31.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Yohnk argues sentencing.

COURT:  Costs and 30 days county jail with credit for 15 days time served and good time to begin on/before 10/30/15 by 3:00 PM.  Bond to be applied towards costs.

Defendant Anthony James Trepania in court, in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  Also has 15 CM 31.  Court addressed the defendant.  State makes stmt to the court.  State spoke to Atty Jarvis he needs to reapply for a public defender.    Court makes stmt.  Defendant states he spoke to the PD today and one would be appointed to him today.  Court addressed Ms. Yohnke.  Court makes stmt as the defendant has stated he would like to resolve the case today, court advised him that can not happen today.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Notice from Public Defender- they do not currently represent DEF

Defendant Anthony James Trepania in court, in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CM 31.  Court makes stmt.  State addressed the court - requests $500.00 cash for combined cases.  Court $500.00 on each case.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Prior: 13714 W Tall Pines Rd, Hayward, WI 54843 United States

Defendant Anthony James Trepania not in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests warrants with bail forfeiture proceedings.  Court grants warrants ordered and bail forfeiture hearings to begin

Defendant Anthony James Trepania in court, in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE satisfied w/video.  CBS $300; no contact with Robert Barber Combined bond 15CM31, 14CM306.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Attorney Martin Jarvis in court.  No appearance by DEF, 11:33 am.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No bond ordered on file.

Defendant Anthony James Trepania in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Off the Record - to set new dates  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 11:00 am. Scheduling conference also set for June 18, 2015 @ 8:15 am.

Defendant Anthony James Trepania in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  DEF pleads Not Guilty, entered by court.  No bond ordered in this case.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.
